homosexuality.label: Homosexual activity
homosexuality.description: Consensual sexual activity between individuals of the same sex.

current_status.description: Homosexuality was decriminalized in Ireland with the the passing of the Criminal Law (Sexual Offences) Act, 1993.

marriage.label: Same-sex marriage
marriage.description: Marriage and marriage recognition between two people of the same biological sex and/or gender identity.

current_status.description: The Thirty-fourth Amendment of the Constitution (Marriage Equality) Bill 2015 (bill no.5 of 2015)

changing-gender.label: Right to change legal gender
changing-gender.description: Legal recognition of sex reassignment by permitting a change of legal gender on an individual's birth certificate.

current_status.description: For adults over 18, individuals can change their legal gender without a surgery. However, for individuals between the age of 16-18, there is a "route to recognition"

adoption.label: Same-sex adoption
adoption.description: The ability for same-sex couples to legally adopt a child.

current_status.description: As Same Sex Marriage is now fully legal, same sex couples can adopt children. One month before it became legal, same sex couples can also adopt children.

discrimination.label: LGBT discrimination
discrimination.description: Prohibition of discrimination based on sexual orientation and/or gender identity.

current_status.description:
States that it is illegal to discriminate against someone based on their sexual orientation in most cases. The law does not state anything about discriminating against transgender people.

There are specific exemption in place for areas such as religious institutions

housing-discrimination.label: LGBT housing discrimination
housing-discrimination.description: Prohibition of discrimination based on sexual orientation and/or gender identity when applying for housing or discrimination by landlords / property owners.

current_status.description: Ireland's Employment Equality Act, 1998, and the Equal Status Act, 2000 outlawed discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.

employment-discrimination.label: LGBT employment discrimination
employment-discrimination.description: Prohibition of discrimination based on sexual orientation and/or gender identity in employment, including hiring, promotion, termination, harassment, etc.

current_status.description: Ireland's Employment Equality Act, 1998, and the Equal Status Act, 2000 outlawed discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.

military.label: Homosexuals serving openly in military
military.description: The ability for homosexuals to serve in the military and be open about their sexuality.

current_status.description: Section 1.5 of Ireland's Defence Forces's "Equality, Diversity, and Equal Status Policies" state that "the nine (9) grounds on which discrimination is prohibited are: Gender, marital status, family status, disability, sexual orientation, age, religion, race and membership of the Traveller community."

age-of-consent.label: Equal age of consent
age-of-consent.description: The difference between legal age of consent for homosexual sex and heterosexual sex.

current_status.description: The age of consent in Ireland is 17 for heterosexual and homosexual sex. Section 2 of the Criminal Law (Sexual Offences) Act 1993 states: "Subject to sections 3 and 5 of this Act, any rule of law by virtue of which buggery between persons is an offence is hereby abolished."

blood.label: Blood donations by MSMs
blood.description: The ability for MSMs (men who have sex with men) to donate blood or tissue for organ transplants. A deferral period refers to a waiting time before a man can donate after having sex.

current_status.description: The Irish Blood Transfusion Service bans blood from men who have sex with men. Their policy states: "In order to assure the continued safety of the blood supply, we currently ask those people who may have a particularly high risk of carrying blood-borne viruses not to give blood. This includes men who have ever had sex with another man / men."

conversion-therapy.label: Conversion therapy
conversion-therapy.description: Legal status of conducting sexual orientation changing therapy ("ex-gay" therapy)
